required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic and Biochemical Characteristics of Human Adipose Tissue
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of White Adipose Tissue (WAT) in Morbid Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: Research the genetic and biomechanical markers of human adipose tissue on patients with morbid obesity. Additional tissue/fluid collection is also gathered during the time of surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Screening

primary_outcome.measure: Tensile Strength of White Adipose Tissue
primary_outcome.description: During the research tissue samples were compared between healthy obese patients (no diabetes, controlled HTN, no dyslipidemia) with tissue samples collected on non-healthy obese patients (type II diabetes) and using fat collected from mice as a control.

clinical_study.condition: Study is to Better Understand the Genetic Composition of Adipose Tissue in the Morbidly Obese Population Undergoing Bariatric Surgery.

arm_group.description: Patients consented to participate have met the NIH criteria for Bariatric Surgery and have completed the normal pre-operative work up including nutritional counseling, psychological evaluation, and all necessary studies to rule out other co-morbid conditions prior to surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet NIH Criteria for Bariatric Surgery
- Between the Age of 18-65
- Dyslipidemia controlled with medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled Metabolic syndrome (uncontrolled diabetes, htn, dyslipidemia), one or all conditions.

overall_official.affiliation: University of California Davis Health System

facility.name: University of California Davis Medical Center

clinical_study.keyword: Bariatric Surgery, Obesity, White Adipose Tissue
